Summary: I've stayed here numerous times and really think that the rooms are decent in size, very clean and no problem. This time I was given rm# 105. This room is small, extremely small my closet is bigger. I was very disappointed in that room.

Summary Heading: get a kitchenette with no utensils
Summary: There are better places for a similar price. The room was old but livable. We were staying a few days in the area so we decided that for a few dollars more we would get the room that included a kitchenette. There were NO pots, no pans, no eating utensils, no coffee pot, no cups or glasses,,, nothing that you would expect in a kitchenette. When I talked to the front desk, they said we haven't had those things for years. I complained that the room should be discounted to the normal room price. No such luck!
Room tip: bring your own kitchen utensils if you get the kitchenette.

Summary Heading: Loved my stay at Vagabond Inn La Habra - thank you!
Summary: Great stay and the location is perfectly tucked a half block in from La Habra Blvd. so not noisy at night. It was conveniently located to many community amenities such as LA Fitness and restaurants and the freeway. Thanks again!

Hotel was in a great location for us since it was between two destinations.  The room was decent and clean, no issues there.  Guy at the desk was a little cold and grumpy, especially when I rang the bell at 1 am because there wasn't a SINGLE parking spot in the entire lot for us.  Parking lot of idiotic, one way in and had to back the entire way out if it was full.  Not well designed at all.  Decent price, decent room.

The whirlpool was perfect size and deep. It was very exotic to spend a romantic day with my partner. As far as the king size bed, it was clean, cozy and comfortable. I would definitely come back for another round!

This motel is falsely advertised I didn’t feel safe from the area and the set up. Not to mention I feel like my room door was not secure. I also felt like something was crawling on me all night so I didn’t hardly sleep. The bed was small and hard and the room was ridiculously small. I reserved two beds when I got there they told me they only had one room left with one bed. The hotel just looks grimey and I safe. I have to stay in la for a while but I will never stay at the vagabond again it was not worth the price.

Usually our stay is great .we check in early the first ones there. But they put us in room 101.we know this cause we had it once before  Smallest room ever. you got more room in a happy meal.prior leaving office we ask to be moved .lady said NO ALL BOOKED UP. If we are the first ones to check in,why couldn't we be moved.  If we're to check how many times we stayed there more then 5 times .

Summary Heading: Get less than you pay for
Summary: The freshly renovated bath floor was poorly done in rm203. I can't confirm but it looked like some mold buildup in the corners of the bath. The shower water stream was so thin and powerful that it felt like pins and needles on the body.The kitchenette(which we had to pay more for) had no pots, no pans, no silverware, etc... just a 2 burner countertop(I believe that there is an assumption some are provided). Unfortunately, we didn't notice most of this until the morning after we arrived. There was no coffee pot or no iron. There was a hair dryer,,, thats it!  Although advertised on many hotel web sites, there was NO Breakfast.I talked to the on duty person who said thats too bad,,, you wanted a kitchenette and that's what they provided.  As for the coffee pot I could walk over to

The room was small for a 2 double bed accommodation.  What can you ask for $90 a nite?  It has a fridge, a microwave, a big screen and comfortable bedding.  Newly remodeled rooms offer a quiet toilet flush, a nice shower, descent room odor (not an old room smell).  Quiet area as it is located around a residential block, hidden from the busy street.  Basic needs are provided.  Just wished the front desk would be a little bit more friendly.  I believe it is their ability to speak English well that frightens them to communicate.  Otherwise, they are accommodating and would provide what you need.  Parking was limited though, but you can park outside on the street.
Room tip: Choose room close to the hotel front desk.  It is more convenient when you need toiletries and...

Summary: A nightmare, noise everywhere, scandal among guests. The administrators do nothing to maintain order, the manager goes out to see but does not take any action for the peace of the other guests. Guests smoking on the doors of the rooms. bad smell in the rooms. There is no isolation between rooms, conversations are heard from the room next door. The cleaning staff makes too much noise in the mornings when cleaning, they scream, they sing, it's terrible. I would never use this hotel as it is dirty and unsafe for customers.

Summary Heading: Do you like hard beds and meager rations then this is the hotel for you
Summary: Don't bother not worth the money. The walls are thin, "breakfast" was apples muffins and coffee and the bed was really hard and not even a queen size.  The room I stayed in was very small and I was grateful we were only there for 2 nights.

Dirty, weed smokers, unprofessional, rude and not helpful. Their answer for everything was you have to call the main office. Check in was long and the room was dirty I couldn’t even sit down. So I decided to sit outside on the stairs where I notice 2 guest smoking weed in from of my children (8,13yrs old) and these were adults. The manager and his wife were doing laundry and just walked by as if it was normal. I picked up my things packed my car and checked out. Don’t stay here. They were not even curtious enough to refund me because I didn’t cancel within 24 hrs but I didn’t know what I was getting into.

we were there for a family wedding so we didn't need anything fancy just a basic hotel. which is what this is..having an iron in the room would've been nice instead we had to go buy one. It was wedding attire after all..had to ask for more full size towels since as 2 adults we usually use 2 per shower.and we had to ask for extra pillows,no biggie except they seemed a little bothered by that..queen size bed should have more than 3 small pillows. But the bed was nice...and the room is clean. guess thats all you really need. it does have a fridge and microwave but NO Coffee maker in the room...

The property is very clean which is a plus.  The beds are hard as rocks.  The Clerk became apprehensive when I asked for a receipt when he wanted a $10.00 Cash only deposit for key and remote.  He finally stated he would charge my card if I failed to return the items.  Very suspicious.  Breakfast is only a prepackaged muffin and coffee.  Be aware!

Okay stay. Room smelled terrible upon entry. Had to open window and run fan. Bed is super firm, so if you like that...  Linens appeared clean. Bathroom appeared clean. $10 cash deposit for tv remote, refunded when remote is returned; was not fully explained at check-in. Free wi-fi, have to ask desk for password. No ice machine, no breakfast, maybe coffee at desk (not sure). Microwave and mini-fridge in room. No frills, no fuss. Basically a bed and a shower!

It was great for the price. The king bed room is nice and big, they have direct tv and the room was very clean and nice looking. The wifi didn't really work but overall satisfied with my stay. I would definitely stay here again.

Rooms are clean , comfortable . The accommodations are the best within the surrounding areas for the price. Checking in was hassle free and quick. The property is well maintained and rooms are updated and cozy.

Clean but sparse on supplies No hand towels One tiny round soap to share between sink and tub $10 “ cash” deposit required for tv remote control  No breakfast tho it’s advertised and that’s why I booked it Parking is tight

Clean and comfortable. Close to downtown. Close to places to eat and gas station. The service at night was kind and helpful. Parking is hard to get in and out of. Several things did not work and needed to be replaced. No ice machine.

I am a frequent guest at this hidden gem in La Habra. I live in the bay area and have stayed here several times. I initially booked online because of the appearance of the cozy, newly renovated rooms. I get to town on average every two months and plan to stay here each time. The staff is friendly and courteous and has been available for very late check ins, which I appreciate because I never know how late I will be visiting with my baby grandson and the rest of the family.

We have the first room close the front desk, before to get in we ask about the ring bell, the guy is in the desk say dont worry is stop at night, but is not true, we earing all night, is too noise to sleep well.

We had a great stay, a good nights sleep, and happy the showers had good pressure! The staff was friendly and the place was quiet, overall we were happy with our stay in the Vagabond Inn!! We would stay again,

The housekeeping clean the room magnificently. I will recommend this Motel to anybody because the owners are very friendly. On Saturdays and Sundays they have breakfast like bananas, apples, muffins, & coffee. This place is one of the best motels I've ever been to.

Ive been staying at this location for easily over 40 stays since becoming Vagabond, and have never heard or extended an offer for information on it. Very dissapointed to say none the less. Always have gone above and beyond otherwise.

I am sure its a better hotel than it is, However, there wasd almost no hot water, the towels were hard and the toilet paper was terrible Had to buy my own. also the room had an odd smell, almost like it was soaked in smoke and wiped down in chemical. (non-smoking room) had to wash everything when i got home, all my things smelled of that room. wierd

We stayed five nights.  Motel has newly refurbished rooms.  It is a quiet location and convenient to many attractions.  Breakfast consisted of commercial chocolate muffins coffee and apples on the weekend and coffee during the week.  Room service was slow to begin but once it began, it was good.  Everything worked fine.  WIFI did not work real well inside the room but reception was better outside. An iron was available; but no ironing boards were available.  Be prepared to buy some items for breakfast or eat out.   Our room had a refrigerator and microwave; and my understanding is that all rooms have these.  The TV's were widescreen with a wide variety of programming.  Staff in the office was friendly.  Overall, we had a good experience and would come back.   .

Ants in room joined me in bed shortly after the late check-in next door began blasting the TV, chattering, and driving back and forth to the store for snacks. I cut the checkout time close due to exhaustion and the check-out staff was kind of gruff about the whole thing. I hope they hire a good exterminator and post quiet time rules.

Summary Heading: Not Satissfied With Hotel Clerk Info
Summary: Not happy with price recommendation from clerk when I was contacting him by the phone nonunderstanding of prices he was giving and what was online he was trying to make me pay mor then listed advertisement and stated rooms were sold out night I needed the room , which I was still able to book on line and get to stay at the Vagabond in.

The renovations at this site make it quite comfortable. The room was on the small side, but it was just for me so not an issue. But it was modern and clean. I wish the bed had a softer mattress, but I still slept well. They have full cable channels and I was able to watch Game of Thrones on HBO! At no extra charge! Vagabond has really come a long way to provide a much better stay at a great price!

Honestly was not impressed at all, for literally just 10 dollars more i could have gone to a better hotel with all the same amenities and a bigger room. I only got the double bed room and it looked spacious on the pictures but was actually extremely small and tight

The room was clean and nice whe we arrived on Thurs. but was not cleaned again until Sunday afternoon. There are no hand towels or ice machine. I guess the old adage is true you get what you pay for...

This hotel doesn't have Non-Smoking room. I made reservation of Non-Smoking room but I was assigned a room with strong smoking odor covered by air spray. Also, if you don't wear shoes inside the room, your barefoot sole will be black.
